meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>come to an end</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to come to an end</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Your romp finally has <vocabulary>to come to an end</vocabulary> when someone decides to <reading>sue</reading> (す) you for all your romping.
